although it in itself had more or less ananti-gravity feature that gave it no weight, there was no doubt it was too big for the little girl.
it was incomparable to the mass of theblasters she was holding earlier.
fio's expression grew taut as she realizedthe incredibly destructive force that she wasnow holding in her hands.

name: misleet
normalized: no way…a charged particle gun!?
it seemed misleet recognized its way too unrefined form as well.
panic for the first time rose upon that face.

name: fio
normalized: confirming particle accelerator sequencetermination--
the charged particle gun rose up with aheavy growl like it was resounding from thepits of the earth.
the weapon's strength was normally lower in an atmosphere, but science wouldn't produce anything like it on earth for another millennium.

name: fio
normalized: magnetic field stable,confirming final sequence code!
she forcibly setup a surrounding magneticfield and prepared an accelerated particletrajectory.

name: misleet
normalized: ku, you!
misleet was the target of that trajectory.

name: fio
normalized: here goes!
and then, the moment fio applied strengthto her fingers on the trigger that stoodalone from the body of the barrel…

name: fio
normalized: …eh?
suddenly, that expression grew clouded.

name: fio
normalized: why is the gauge off the scale…?
well then, like this…kuu!
forcing cancel!
suddenly, a metallic sound that hurt theears echoed all around.

name: yuu
normalized: kuu!?
it was the dissonance of space warping fromfio forcibly rescinding the weapon just asit was on the verge of firing.

name: yuu
normalized: you didn't shoot it?
i had spoken it simply like that.
and, misleet's form had alreadydisappeared from the premises.
i guess she had figured it wasn't worth therisk and escaped with the appearance of thepowerful weapon she hadn't expected.

name: fio
normalized: hahhah…hah…
having terminated the discharge of the charged particle gun, fio just stood stockstill breathing heavily.

name: yuu
normalized: …chi
i clicked the tip of my tongue.
it was a failure.

name: yuu
normalized: damned brat…
i had muttered a little bitterly so thatno one else could hear it.
and then, after taking out and swallowingthe pills from the pill case i had taken frommy chest pocket, i began walking over to fio.

name: yuu
normalized: wh, why didn't you shoot it?

name: fio
normalized: hah, hah…the limiter wasn't turned on
and then, she turned a weary face at meputting on a friendly face in the midst ofwalking over to her.

name: yuu
normalized: n, no way.
didn't i set it up properly?

name: fio
normalized: y, yeah.
it wasn't yuu-san's fault.
i'm not use to using things like a charged particle gun and thought it was faulty.
but…that was close
so, if she she had pulled the trigger, then…?

name: fio
normalized: hah…i'm glad i realized at the last moment
fio blew a deep sigh with that.
why had she not pulled the trigger…?
while wracking my brain over that,i took my eyes off of fio for a moment.

name: fio
normalized: what's wrong, yuu-san?

name: yuu
normalized: …no, i was thinking that no matter theharbor, the scenery always feels familiar…
i muttered, not matching eyes with her.

name: fio
normalized: hoeh?
…th, that's right, huh.
i guess yuu-san doesn't know any other planet than earth, but the scenery is the same no matter the harbor or even the planet?
fio babbled something conscientiously,which seemed befitting of her weariness.

name: yuu
normalized: …damn brat…gah
i muttered once more in a whisper so thatthat newbie space detective couldn't hear me.
